member.name: T:BizUnit.BizUnit
member.summary: BizUnit test framework for the rapid development of automated test cases.
member.remarks:
The following example demonstrates how to create and call BizUnit:
namespace WoodgroveBank.BVTs { using System; using NUnit.Framework; using BizUnit;
// This is an example of calling BizUnit from NUnit... [TestFixture] public class SmokeTests { [Test] public void Test_01_Adapter_MSMQ() { BizUnit bizUnit = new BizUnit(@".\TestCases\Test_01_Adapter_MSMQ.xml"); bizUnit.RunTest(); } } }
Test cases are defined with three stages:
1. TestSetup - used to setup the conditions ready to execute the test
2. TestExecution - the main execution stage of the test
3: TestCleanup - the final stage is always executed regardless of whether the test passes or fails in order to leave the system in the state prior to executing the test
The following illustrates the structure of a test case:
...
...
...
...
Tag Description
TestCase/_testName The name of the test case being executed
TestSetup The setup stage of the test case, containing zero or more test steps
TestExecution The execution stage of the test case, containing zero or more test steps
TestExecution/runConcurrently If runConcurrently is set to true the test step will be executed concurrently, meaning that subsequent test steps will be started immediately after this test step has started. BizUnit will wait for all of the outstanding test steps executing in concurrent mode before running the TestCleanup stage.
TestCleanup The clenaup stage should return the system to the state prior to executing the test, for example, if messages were written to various MSMQ queue's, the TestCleanup stage should ensure that all of those queues are empty.
Wild cards contained in configuration will be replaced if the test steps extract the configuration using the _context helper class. E.g. For the test step configuration below:
..\..\..\TestData\InDoc1.xml ..\..\..\Rec_03\TransactionId_%Guid%_%ServerName%.xml
CreationPath becomes "..\..\..\Rec_03\TransactionId_12345678-D6AB-4aa9-A772-938972E3FD51_ZEUS001.xml"

member.name: T:BizUnit.Context
member.summary: Represents a state object that is passed between BizUnit test steps.
member.remarks: The context is passed by BizUnit to each individual test step, state maybe written to or read from the context, note the following wild cards are supported: %DateTime%, %DateTimeISO8601%, %ServerName% and %Guid%. The context also provides helper methods for test steps to read their configuration, and to log information, warnings, errors and data in a consistent manner. The context contains some standard information on the current test executing, such as BizUnitTestCaseName which contains the name of the current test case being executed and BizUnitTestCaseStartTime which contains the time the current test case started.
